utterance.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
utterance.content: On the ground! Now!

utterance.speaker: JOHN HENSON
utterance.content: Frank? Frank.

utterance.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
utterance.content: Take a seat, son.

utterance.speaker: BAILIFF
utterance.content: Please rise.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE KERRY FALLBROOK
utterance.content: Frank Henson, fifteen years ago you were convicted by the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania for the 1998 murder of Kimberly Tolbert. You were sentenced to death. This court has found insufficient evidence to grant an emergency stay, thus your execution will proceed as scheduled at midnight three days from today. Court is adjourned.

utterance.speaker: PROFESSOR EDGAR MCDONALD
utterance.content: John. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Thank you, Professor. You folks did everything you could. I know my brother appreciates it.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Frank.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This can’t be it. There’s got to be something more we can do. What about the lab work we were going to test again, or what about -

utterance.speaker: MCDONALD
utterance.content: Alexis, we’ve played every card. Sometimes the good guys don’t win.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: I am not giving up. And you know why? Because it’s the best idea ever.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I am not getting married in space.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not? We could be the first. Commercial space flight is only a couple years away. And you said you wanted it to be special.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, because when I was a little girl imagining my wedding day, being stuck in a small tin can with a thousand tons of rocket fuel strapped to my ass was exactly what I had in mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then we agree.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you don’t want to go and look at wedding venues this weekend, then just say so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t want to go look at wedding venues this weekend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Too bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. It’s um … a text alert on a project Alexis is working on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought you guys weren’t talking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not. Rather, she’s not. So I insulted her boyfriend. What’s the prison sentence on that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Castle, just give her some time. She’ll get over it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what you think. Once when she was three I refused to buy her a candy bar. She held her breath until she passed out. You have no idea how determined she can be.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Alexis, we looked at the case files like you asked. I gotta say, there’s nothing in there that says this guy’s innocent.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What about the swabs from Kim Tolbert’s body that were submitted to the New York Trace Lab for retesting? I mean, they’ve had them for weeks.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’ve been calling every day to move things along, but it’s not in our jurisdiction.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You don’t understand. A man is going to die in three days unless we do something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We do understand. There’s just not much that we can do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about your dad? Have you talked to him about this case?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe he’ll spot something that no one else did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … you’re here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I need your help. But just because I’m asking doesn’t mean things are okay between us. I’m still mad at you, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ve been working this Innocence Review case with my criminal law professor. This guy is on death row for killing his neighbor, a high school girl, but he didn’t do it. And they’re about to execute him for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you know he didn’t do it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, for one thing, he had rotator cuff surgery four months before. He couldn’t have swung the fireplace poker used to kill the victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under the rush of adrenaline you’d be surprised what people are capable of.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You sound just like the prosecutor. But there’s more. They found fresh tire tracks in the dirt outside the victim’s back door. Bicycle treads.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Frank didn’t own a bike.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. He was 24 then. He worked on cars … … wait, how do you know his name?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You just said it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You know about the case. How.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah … how? I must have seen the file on Esposito’s desk.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’ve been checking up on me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No … no. Well, a little. Yes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I couldn’t help it. You’re my daughter. I’m interested in your life but you won’t return my calls.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, so, did you find anything in the file? Anything that could help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, he did have priors. What makes you think he’s innocent?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because I know him, Dad. I’ve spent time with him. He’s not a killer. I know what the evidence says, but he didn’t do this. I need you to come to Pennsylvania with me. I need you to help me prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. C’mon, I get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’ll only be for a couple of days, ‘cause that’s pretty much all the time there is left. And it’s a chance for Alexis and me to reconnect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you don’t have to explain. We can look at venues another day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure you’re all right with this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. I mean, she’s practically family. I care about her, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re pretty great, you know that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Now go spend some time with your daughter.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MCDONALD
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It has been a long time since we’ve taken a road trip together. Remember the time we went to Amish country? Ended up getting chased by the cow?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, this isn’t a road trip. And this isn’t about fun. It’s about having less than 72 hours to save a man from execution. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Fasten your seatbelt. It’s going to be a bumpy ride.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … uh … how is – how is Pi? Everything still good?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why are you asking about Pi?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – – just thought we should chat –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I know what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What am I doing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re trying to bond.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m not.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes, you are. We haven’t talked in weeks, so now you’re trying to make this about us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m not. I wasn’t, so … Well, what if I was? Would that be so bad?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I just thought you were here for the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then how come you haven’t asked a single question about it since we left?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Um … so what do I need to know?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Frank Henson, the accused. We’re meeting him at the prison. He’s Pennsylvania blue collar. Struggled through high school, but he’s smart. He earned his automotive mechanic degree in ’95. He’s a little rough around the edges but he’s got a good heart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, and … then there’s Maggie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s Maggie?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maggie Ingram. The love of his life. She’ll be at the prison, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Love of his life? Is that one of those prison pen pal romance things?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, no. She’s his high school sweetheart. He proposed to her two weeks before his arrest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she stayed with him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She’s been by his side the whole time. Every hearing, every appeal. She’s the one who wrote to the Innocence Review every week for three years to get us involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Alexis, um … this is a long shot, you know that, right? I mean, it may not work out the way you hope. I - I just don’t want to see you hurt.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I know these people. I care about them. It already hurts.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Alexis.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maggie, this is my Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, thanks for coming. I’d almost given up, until Alexis called.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Hey, baby.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Hey, sunshine.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: So what is this? A going away party?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No. They came back to help.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Help how? I lost the appeal. It’s over, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No. It’s not over. Not yet. This is Mr. Castle, Alexis’s father.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, Mr. Castle. Your girl’s one in a million. You should be proud.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I am.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: So are you some kind of lawyer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: You a cop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No … I’m a … mystery writer.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: He’s more than that. He’s helped the NYPD crack their biggest cases.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I – I don’t want to oversell it.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: You ever save a guy on death row?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But my dad’s a genius at uncovering the real story. Frank, I know you’ve been through this more times than you can stomach, but if you can, tell him what happened that night.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Frank.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I was working on my Camaro. I spent every waking hour with it back then. That night I was working on the exhaust system. The house alarm went off.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I was doing some welding and the smoke set off the garage alarm. The code is ‘stingray 7’.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: It’s off now. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: That’s when I heard the screams across the street. I ran over to see what happened.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Hello? Is everyone all right?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: The back door was open, so I went inside.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: She was lying there. Blood … whatever happened, I was too late.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I heard the sirens and I panicked. I mean, I knew how it looked, so I took a rag and tried to wipe down all my prints. But I ran out of time.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I had her blood on me and a police record. It went the way you’d expect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about your home security company? Did they have a record of your call?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes. But the prosecution argued it still left plenty of time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How well did you know Kim Tolbert?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Not that well. I mean, her mom and her lived there a few years. Kim flirted with me a little bit. I was friendly, but that was it.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: They entered her diary into record. She wrote that she had a crush on Frank, so the prosecutor made Frank out to be some sort of predator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you didn’t see anyone as you ran to the house?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No. They must have bolted out the back before I got there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what about back then? Anybody she was having a problem with?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Lyle Gomez. Kim’s ex-boyfriend. They had a very stormy relationship. Plus, she dumped him a week before she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Police talk to him?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: They didn’t have to. They had me. Mr. Castle, I’ve got three days left on God’s earth. I don’t need you to find the real killer. I just need somebody to prove it wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, take it easy. Calm down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Calm down? You should have seen the way these people looked at me. Like I’m some kind of savior. I don’t even know if he’s innocent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, how can I help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t even know if I can help. I mean, what if I can’t? Alexis would never forgive me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just do your best, Castle. I mean, she loves you. And I’m here. For both of you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s coming. I’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ready to get started?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This is everything spanning the life of the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The least your professor could have done was thrown in some CliffsNotes. So what do we know about this ex-boyfriend of Kim’s, Lyle Gomez?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh … he was a varsity football player, hot and cold relationship with Kim. Everyone that knew him said he had a temper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you guys talk to him?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Professor McDonald and the defense lawyer tried, but Lyle told them he didn’t want to relive it. Said it was too painful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there’s no evidence indicates he might have done it? Nothing at all?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are all these little things on the floor around the body?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Charms. They broke off of her bracelet during the struggle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So before the attack there might have been some pushing and shoving. Lover’s quarrels can start like that, before they turn into something else.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But aside from Maggie’s theory, there’s nothing tying Lyle to any of this. But maybe you’ll see something we missed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So that evidence the Innocence Review submitted to the Trace Lab, how close are they to looking at it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, from what we heard it’s going to take weeks. Which means they’ll never get to it in time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, by all accounts Kim was a bright, beautiful girl who everyone loved. She had no enemies to speak of and nothing close to anyone other than Frank.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because they didn’t look at anyone other than Frank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe because … it was Frank. Look, I’m sorry, Alexis. It’s just, sometimes –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Fine. But if it was Frank, what was his motive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER TED LANE
utterance.content: Wow. You Innocence Review folks just won’t give up, will you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I help you, Officer … … Lane?

utterance.speaker: LANE
utterance.content: Kim’s murder tore this town apart. I guess we’re just wondering what you all are fighting for.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Justice.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Justice? He had her blood on his hands when they caught him. He was holding the shop rag that he used to wipe down the crime scene. You want justice? Let him meet his maker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Has it been like that the whole time?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, let’s go over this again. Frank hears the scream, he runs across the way, he bangs on the door. It’s locked. He runs around the back.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He finds the back door open, he goes inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The back door was open. Wait. What time of year was the murder? November?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. The 13th. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 1998. The temperature that night was … … 40 degrees.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that’s far too cold for Kim to have left the door open. Yet according to Frank, it was open. Presumably because someone else committed the crime.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, but everyone thinks he’s lying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but what they don’t see, what no one sees, is that we can prove whether or not he was lying. C’mon. I’ll get the car. You pay the check.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What? Dad –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: C’mon, Dad. Would you please tell me what you’re doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Frank is guilty, then he would have opened the back door. Which means he would have wiped down the doorknob to get rid of his fingerprints.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But if he’s telling the truth and the back door was already open he wouldn’t have needed to wipe it, because he never touched it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that would mean someone else was there that night. But the question is, did CSU dust that doorknob for fingerprints? Here it is. They did.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was wiped clean. Sorry, sweetie. He lied.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But it doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. I wanted to believe him as much as you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, I mean this report. It says the backdoor was totally clean. No prints, no nothing. So Frank couldn’t have wiped it down. The shop rag Frank used was covered in grease from working on his car. They found traces of grease in other places where he wiped down his prints. But there’s no mention of it on the doorknob. It isn’t in the report. Dad, if there isn’t any grease …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then someone else was there, wiped down the doorknob before Frank got there, getting rid of their own prints. Someone else was there that night. Sweetie, you were right. Someone else killed Kim Tolbert.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes, Professor. I understand. Okay. Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’d he say?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s not enough.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we know someone else wiped down the doorknob.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, but he says you can’t build a case based on evidence that isn’t there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Beckett. Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … not so good. We’d be grasping at straws if we had any.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I might have one for you. I went to the Trace Lab last night. Their people wouldn’t run your case evidence. But I found someone else that would.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: It’s Lanie. Put me on speaker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Um… you’re on.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Alexis, why on Earth wouldn’t you come to me directly?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Lanie? I didn’t know you could do –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She convinced a contact at the lab to run evidence after hours.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Now, we retested every swab taken from Kim’s body fifteen years ago. Everything listed in Pennsylvania’s report came out in our report, with the exception of one thing. We found trace amounts of ammonium nitrate that their lab never picked up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ammonium nitrate?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s an oxidizing agent commonly found in cold pack, uh … explosives, fertilizer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fertilizer. Wait. Lyle Gomez. Kim’s ex-boyfriend. He used to work at a gardening store.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, it’s him. That’s why he wouldn’t speak with us. We have to go talk to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. If you guys think someone out there is involved, then you need to get ahold of the police.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t think the police are going to be of much help out here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if he’s your killer he’s dangerous. I can’t help you if something happens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, look, Beckett. Frank Henson has two days to live. This is our only lead. What else are we supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, odds are Lyle Gomez will not want to speak with us. But I’ve had experience with guys like this. You just leave it to me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, there he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, that does not bode well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Where do you think you’re going?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: To talk to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, Alexis, no. Absolutely not. He just gave us a none-too-subtle hunt.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He was looking at you. He won’t talk to you. But I can reach him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The man is a possible murder suspect.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He won’t do anything with you here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what makes you even think he’s going to open the door to you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m a teenage girl. I’ll remind him of Kim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m not –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m not asking for permission.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll be watching you like a hawk.

utterance.speaker: LYLE GOMEZ
utterance.content: You people need to stay off my property.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I guess Kim was wrong about you.

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I read her diary. She said you were kind, caring. Made her feel safe.

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: What else did she say?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why don’t you let me in?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: Not a day goes by I don’t think about her. You even been in love so bad it hurts?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is that why you don’t talk about it? Where were you when it happened?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: Kim called me that night. She wanted me to pick her up from Jasper Grove.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Jasper Grove, what’s that?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: Fogland woods, east of town. Kids party there. She must have gone to one, which surprised me, because she barely ever drank.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But Kim broke up with you, right? So why’d she call you?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: She said I was the only one she could trust. She was upset.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: She didn’t say. I figured somebody hit on her. Anyway, she asked me to drive her home, so I did.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What happened then?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: I was hoping that her calling meant that she give me another chance. So I asked if I could come in.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And did you?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: She wanted to be alone. She said she had some decisions she needed to make. So I decided I needed to get drunk. I went and I shoplifted a pint of Jack, but the shop owner caught me. He made me pick up every single piece of litter in his parking lot as punishment. And when I heard the sirens I thought he was arresting me, too. The sirens were for Kim. When I got to her house, I saw Frank. I saw her body on the stretcher. If I had just found a way to stay there, she’d still be alive.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did you tell this to the police?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: They didn’t ask. Why would they? They had the guy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why do you think Frank killed her?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: Maybe he got jealous. He didn’t like seeing her with other guys.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What other guys?

utterance.speaker: LYLE
utterance.content: I didn’t ask. But I know they dropped by her house. Other boys.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Overreacting, maybe. You were in there a long time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And I came away with some leads. Turns out Kim was seeing other boys.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: What other boys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were hoping you could tell us.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You lived across the street from her. Do you remember any other guys going to her house?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: That was fifteen years ago.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This is important, Frank. One of them may be involved in her death.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: This is the only lead that you have?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re also looking into the party Kim went to that night. We have NYPD checking, seeing if anything was reported in Jasper Grove that could connect to her murder.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Try to focus on kids that you saw at Kim’s house. Anything you can remember. Hair color, cars they drove, bikes that they rode. Not just that day. Any day. Try to think.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I’m tired of thinking. I’m tired all around, to tell you the truth.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Frank.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: It’s over, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Don’t say that.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: All these years Maggie has been leading this charge. She’s been my rock. And now I’ve gotta be hers. And I’ve got less than two days to help her make peace with what’s about to come. The last thing that she needs is more false hope.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This isn’t false hope –

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: It is false hope.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: - this could be what turns everything else around.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: It’s done. It’s done, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Guard.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Listen, I appreciate everything that you’ve done. Everything that you’ve tried to do. But it’s time to let it go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, we might be on to something. How can Frank just give up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After what he’s been through, I can’t blame him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So you’re giving up, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We are going to follow every possible lead, but we can’t go back to Frank. Not until we have solid evidence that he’s innocent.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan. Did you come up with anything on Jasper Grove?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No police or incident reports from the night that Kim Tolbert died; however, I did find definite signs of trouble in Jasper Grove.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A farmhouse there was foreclosed on in ’97, stood empty until ’99 when a young family bought it. But as soon as they moved in, they all got sick. Turns out the place was contaminated with toxic chemicals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, high levels of residue from methamphetamine production, which might explain your ammonium nitrate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone was using the farmhouse to make meth?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And it looks like it might have been kids.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What makes you say that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Photos from the county’s assessor’s office show bicycle tracks in the dirt all over the property.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you very much, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Bike tracks. There were bike tracks outside of Kim’s house. Dad, do you realize what this means?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That maybe the party Kim went to was at that farmhouse and she saw kids doing meth.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, not just doing meth. Cooking meth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’s why she had to get out of there. That’s why she told Lyle she had some decisions to make.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She was thinking about turning them in. So maybe when she left the party –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One of our teenage meth cookers got word she’d go to the cops.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He went after her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On his bike.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The tire tracks at her house? He knew where she lived because he’d been there before.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He was one of the other guys Kim was seeing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_ALEXIS
utterance.content: We need to talk to Kim’s mother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now that was weird. Usually I do that with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Eww.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. I um … I just wanted to thank you for all of your help with Castle and Alexis.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Seems like you could have done that over the phone. All right. Talk to me, girlfriend. Tell me what’s on your mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you find it odd that Alexis has gone to everyone but me on this case?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: She hasn’t gone to Perlmutter yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, no one does if they can help it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, you can’t take it personally.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I know. It’s just … … Castle and I are about to become a family, which is weird enough as it is. And he and Alexis have this whole history that has nothing to do with me. And it kind of feels like when it comes to the two of them, I’m always gonna be on the outside.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Perfect families don’t exist. It’s going to be up to you to find a way to make your baggage match their baggage. It’s up to you to make your own history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mrs. Tolbert, we’re very sorry to intrude.

utterance.speaker: PATRICE TOLBERT
utterance.content: You have some nerve. I know who you are. What you’re trying to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever you may have heard about us, we’re not here to tell you Frank Henson is innocent.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We’d just like to ask you some questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Questions no one else could answer, otherwise we would not bother you.

utterance.speaker: PATRICE
utterance.content: What questions?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did Kim have problems with any of the other guys she was seeing?

utterance.speaker: PATRICE
utterance.content: There was no one else. Just Lyle. And she just broke it off with him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, it’s just that we had heard that some other boys had stopped by the house.

utterance.speaker: PATRICE
utterance.content: Some boys. Yeah, she was a tutor. Some of her students were embarrassed that they needed help so she kept things quiet. That’s who she was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you remember these students' names?

utterance.speaker: PATRICE
utterance.content: I’m not about to let you hang this on one of them. Now you need to leave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for your time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, oh! Ma’am, just one more question. What subject did Kim tutor?

utterance.speaker: PATRICE
utterance.content: Chemistry.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. Kim tutored chemistry. So what if one of her students tricked her into helping him learn how to cook meth, and when she figured out what he was doing he killed her?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, there’s something else.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: As soon as Mrs. Tolbert said chemistry I remembered. Two identical chemistry books were found at the scene of the crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So maybe the other one belonged to one of her students.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Right. But a textbook like this is expensive. If you lost one you’d have to pay a fine. You’d want it back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless it would implicate you in a murder.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, if we figure out whose book this is, we might find our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know if it’s possible, honey. That book’s over 15 years old.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s worth a shot.

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: Actually, some of them are over 20 years old. But because of budget cuts we still use them.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can you pull up records all the way back to 1998?

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: Well, even if I can I probably shouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh .. … perhaps a generous donation for new textbooks is in order.

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: I suppose I could bend the rules.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: These are the barcodes form each book.

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: Make it out to cash.

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: Oh … let’s see. Both are them are actually still in our system. Loaned out September 8th, 1998. Neither was ever returned.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Any way you can find out who they belonged to?

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: Hum. One was Kim Tolbert’s. The poor girl who died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the other one?

utterance.speaker: BETTY
utterance.content: Mmm … looks like it belonged to one John Henson.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Frank’s younger brother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The chemistry book puts John in Kim’s house. But we’re going to need a lot more than that to prove he’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: These files are all on Frank. There’s not a lot here on John. How long until Ryan finishes his background check?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He should be calling any minute. Have you managed to find anything that might link John to the murder?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. But I did find something that links John to Kim. According to this accident report, Frank was speeding and got into a car crash in 1997. John was with him. He was hurt pretty badly. He had to miss a lot of school. He was taking chemistry that semester, which is probably why he needed tutoring from Kim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That would be Ryan. John Henson. Clean record. No convictions, no arrests. No, wait. One arrest in ’98. 3 months before Kim was killed. For possession of a controlled substance.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Meth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t say. And the charges were dropped. But this establishes John was involved with drugs.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And if Kim had gone to the police saying he was a meth cooker he wouldn’t have gotten off with a slap on the wrist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We need to talk to John.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: According to this he lives in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming in, Mr. Henson.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Anything for Frank. Of course, at this point he needs a miracle. I’ve always supported my brother. I never wanted to think he could’ve hurt Kim, but if someone else did this why haven’t they been found by now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe no one was looking in the right place. Now, how well did you know Kim?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I saw her every day at school.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anywhere else? Outside of class?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Her house, sometimes. She tutored me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And were you at her house the day that she died?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We were just wondering what your chemistry book was doing at her house.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Well, I must have left it there. Or forgot it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you never asked for it back? I mean, Kim was killed somewhere in the middle of your school term. Wouldn’t you have needed it?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Well, I might’ve bought a new one. It was a long time ago. I don’t really remember. Why does that matter?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it probably doesn’t. Um … now in your statement you said that you were in your room at the time of Kim’s murder but you didn’t hear her scream.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you hear any other unusual sounds that night?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Uh … not that I can think of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the smoke alarm?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Yeah, no, I did hear that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In Frank’s trial testimony he never mentions you coming down to the garage. So you were in your room the whole time the alarm was going off?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: Yes, I was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, I find that odd, Mr. Henson. Because the security company logs show that the alarm sounded for a full two minutes and forty-seven seconds. But you stayed in your room that whole time, never got up to check and make sure that the house wasn’t burning down?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You never heard the alarm going off, did you? Because you weren’t in your house.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: What are you saying? That I killed Kim? That I did it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you that night?

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I’m not answering any more of your questions.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: What is this, guys? I thought we were done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Henson, we’ve … uh … uncovered some new evidence. Evidence that suggests someone else killed Kim Tolbert.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Frank, I know that this is going to be hard to hear, but we think it could be John.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No, John. Based on what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His chemistry book was found at the crime scene. His alibi for where he was when Kim died is falling apart.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: What the hell is wrong with you? I told you to drop it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What do you mean? Frank, we’re really onto something.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: And I’m saying get off it. You leave John out of this.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Honey, what’s wrong with you? If John did this –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He knows. He knows it was John.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Frank, is this true?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You knew this whole time? Why would you do this? Why would you throw your life away?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Because I threw his away, okay? I’m the reason why he killed her.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No, Frank, whatever John did, it can’t be your fault.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Remember that Camaro I was telling you about? I rolled that car. With Johnny in it. I walked away. He didn’t. After that injury he wasn’t right for a while. He started taking drugs. Got violent. He’d have these memory lapses. He – he wouldn’t remember what he did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Frank. What really happened that night?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: My worst nightmare came true.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: It’s off now. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: God. What’d you do, John? What’d you do?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: You’ve gotta get out of here. You hear me? Go back to the house. Get cleaned up. Go! Now!

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: The next thing I knew, the cops were there. I mean, what was I supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: People need to know, Frank.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No, they don’t. And if they ask me I’m going to deny it.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: They’re about to kill you.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: And you’re going to let them! When it’s John that did this.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Maggie, he doesn’t remember. It took three, four times for him coming here for me to realize that he – he doesn’t remember anything from that night.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I always hoped I’d get off on some kind of technicality, you know. Not this. Never this. He’s built a life. He’s got a wife. He’s got two kids. I’m not going to take that away from him.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Frank, please.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I’m sorry. This is the way it’s gotta be.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There must be something we can do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not what Frank wants.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But he’s innocent, Dad, and he’s going to die. Tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I actually started believing we could save the day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we almost did.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know how much he loves Maggie. If he just had more time to think about this maybe he’d change his mind. But the clock just ran out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The clock. What time was that 911 call again?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, a neighbor reported hearing the scream at 8:04PM. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We missed something. Come take a look at this photo. This wall decoration could have fallen down during the struggle.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You mean the solar system thingy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not just a solar system thingy. Our orbiting planets don’t line up like that. This is a binary clock.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s a clock?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. For science geeks like Kim. You count the amount of planets in each quadrant and it tells you the time. In this case, 7:32.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: 7:32. That’s a half hour before our 911 call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because the scream that Frank heard came from John when he discovered Kim’s body at 8:04. She’d already been dead for 30 minutes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Both brothers are innocent.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey. I just got off the phone with Kim’s mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. You called Kim’s mom?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Desperate times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she didn’t hang up on you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. She mostly yelled. She wouldn’t tell me who Kim tutored, but she did say that all the checks Kim got tutoring went into her college fund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she was paid by check.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That means somewhere there’s a record of who paid her.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Ryan and Esposito are checking banks now. This is it, Dad. Jasper Grove, meth, the bike tracks. If it wasn’t Frank or John it has to be one of those other kids. You’re still going through that video?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Now that we know neither Frank nor John killed her, this video plays very differently. Watch this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Frank said he found her body on the floor. Did he ever mention moving her?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. According to Frank he just pulled John away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly, breaking her charm bracelet, spilling the charms on the floor. But watch as the medical examiner’s team moves her body for the first time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See it now?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It looks like another charm from her bracelet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if the charm bracelet broke after she died, how did the charm end up under her body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle. We’ve got the evidence box from the lab. What are we looking for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, the evidence log says there should be a bag containing charms from Kim’s broken charm bracelet.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One of those charms should be shaped like a dolphin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You should have the rope bracelet there, too. Thread that dolphin charm onto the bracelet.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay. Threading.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope, can’t do it. The hole’s too small. It doesn’t fit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because it didn’t come from Kim’s bracelet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It was left behind by our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie, can you get DNA off that charm?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe, but it won’t help unless you have someone to match it to.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We need to know who she was tutoring.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You should call them again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just called them twenty minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Why is it taking so long? Ryan found the bank where Kim had her account hours ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The account was closed in ’98. The bank has closed three times since then. They may not have even kept the files.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And what if they didn’t? We’re running out of time. We need to go to the judge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With what? Frank’ll never admit to covering for John. That would put John at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So what do we do? Dad, tell me what to do!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I don’t know. But whatever happens we’re going to deal with it. All right? Together.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m sorry I was mad at you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. I deserved it. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. What are the names?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chief Lane.

utterance.speaker: POLICE CHIEF LANE
utterance.content: May I help you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Chief. But we can help you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This little dolphin pendant was found in Kim Tolbert’s living room the night she died, underneath her body.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF LANE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So it’s not hers.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER LANE
utterance.content: You people are unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Officer Lane, how old were you when Kim died?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER LANE
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You were in her class. In fact, she tutored you, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: CHIEF LANE
utterance.content: What’s this all about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Checks you wrote to Kim Tolbert, Chief. To pay for your son’s tutoring.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF LANE
utterance.content: He needed some help keeping his grades up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I bet because of the swim team. You guys took State that year. It was big news.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF LANE
utterance.content: Teddy? What’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The night Kim Tolbert was murdered, she was in Jasper Grove, near a farmhouse you had foreclosed on a year earlier. That house was later found to be contaminated with methamphetamine residue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We believe your son was one of the people who contaminated it. We also believe he wanted to be tutored in chemistry so he could learn how to cook meth.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER LANE
utterance.content: This is ridiculous!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Kim caught on to you and that was bad for business. So when she left that party, you followed her.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We found ammonium nitrate on her body. I’d be willing to bet that the tire treads outside the farmhouse are going to be a match to the bike treads behind Kim’s house the night of her murder. And then, of course, there’s that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now that’s enough circumstantial evidence for a judge. But it’s 2013. I mean, now we can even take degraded DNA, have it amplified, tested. And I’m sure that your evidence storage has kept your dolphin well preserved.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF LANE
utterance.content: Teddy. Say something. Look at me. Teddy.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: Based on the overwhelming circumstantial evidence and the exculpatory results obtained from post conviction DNA testing, the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania hereby vacates Franklin Thomas Henson’s murder conviction and sanctions his exoneration.

utterance.speaker: JUDGE
utterance.content: I’m sure you’ve spent far too many years having judges look down on you. So I’ll come down from the bench and deliver the signed order of dismissal myself.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: I thought it was you. All this time you were protecting me.

utterance.speaker: JOHN
utterance.content: How can you ever forgive me?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Oh … forgive you? I love you. I’m just ready to live, brother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What you did here was amazing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thank you. For everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you want to stay and celebrate?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. This is enough. Besides, there’s someone else I need to thank.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
